intro: Coccothrinax gracilis, commonly known as the slender palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean and is characterized by its slender, unbranched stem and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or white, followed by oval-shaped fruits containing edible seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and dry forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in tropical gardens and botanical collections.
